title: Introduction to Digital Marketing
note: This section provides a formal definition of Digital Marketing as the component of marketing that uses the Internet and online-based digital technologies to promote products and services. It contrasts digital marketing with traditional marketing, highlighting its advantages in reach, targeting, and measurability.

title: The Marketing Funnel
note: This lesson introduces the Marketing Funnel, a core model for understanding the customer journey. It explains the typical stages: Awareness (attracting new audiences), Consideration (engaging prospects), Conversion (turning prospects into customers), and Loyalty/Advocacy (retaining existing customers).

title: Core Channel: Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
note: This section introduces SEO as the practice of increasing the quantity and quality of traffic to your website through organic (non-paid) search engine results. It explains the three pillars of SEO: On-Page SEO (content, keywords), Off-Page SEO (backlinks), and Technical SEO.

title: SEO: Keyword Research and On-Page SEO
note: This section covers On-Page SEO, the practice of optimizing individual web pages. It details key elements, including conducting keyword research to understand user intent, and optimizing title tags, meta descriptions, headings (H1, H2), and content for relevance.

title: SEO: Off-Page and Technical SEO
note: This lesson explains Off-Page SEO, focusing on building 'backlinks' to signal authority. It also introduces Technical SEO, which involves optimizing the website's infrastructure, covering topics like site speed, mobile-friendliness, and crawlability for search engines.

title: Core Channel: Search Engine Marketing (SEM)
note: This section introduces SEM as the practice of using paid advertisements on search engines. It explains the Pay-Per-Click (PPC) model, where advertisers pay a fee each time an ad is clicked. The lesson focuses on the Google Ads platform and the concept of an Ad Auction, which combines bid and Quality Score.

title: Core Channel: Content Marketing
note: This section defines Content Marketing as a strategic approach focused on creating and distributing valuable, relevant content (like blog posts, videos, and e-books) to attract and retain a clearly defined audience, ultimately driving profitable customer action.

title: Core Channel: Social Media Marketing (SMM)
note: This lesson introduces SMM as the use of social media platforms to connect with an audience to build a brand, increase sales, and drive website traffic. It contrasts organic social media (community building) with paid social media (targeted ad campaigns).

title: Core Channel: Email Marketing
note: This lesson explains Email Marketing as sending commercial messages to a list of subscribers who have opted in. It is a highly effective channel for nurturing leads and retaining customers. Key components like subject lines, body copy, and calls-to-action (CTAs) are discussed.

title: Core Channel: Affiliate Marketing
note: This lesson explains the affiliate marketing model, a type of performance-based marketing where a business rewards one or more affiliates for each visitor or customer brought by the affiliate's own marketing efforts. It covers the roles of the merchant, affiliate, and network.

title: Core Channel: Influencer Marketing
note: This lesson is dedicated to the strategy of partnering with social media influencers. It covers how to identify relevant influencers, different collaboration models (e.g., sponsored posts, reviews), and how to measure campaign success through metrics like engagement and reach.

title: The Role of a CRM
note: This lesson explains what a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system is (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and why it's central to modern marketing. It covers how a CRM is used to store customer data, track all interactions with the brand, and align the marketing and sales teams.

title: Introduction to Marketing Automation
note: This lesson expands on email marketing to cover the broader concept of automation. It introduces the idea of using platforms (like HubSpot or Marketo) to automate and personalize marketing workflows, such as lead scoring, lead nurturing email sequences, and behavioral triggers.

title: Introduction to Digital Marketing Analytics
note: This section introduces the practice of measuring and analyzing marketing performance to maximize its effectiveness. It emphasizes using data to make decisions and presents Google Analytics as the standard tool for web analytics.

title: Key Metrics and KPIs
note: This lesson defines the most important metrics in digital marketing. It covers Traffic, Bounce Rate, Conversion Rate, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) like Cost Per Acquisition (CPA), Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), and Return on Ad Spend (ROAS).

title: Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
note: This lesson is dedicated to the discipline of improving the percentage of users who perform a desired action (a conversion). It introduces the CRO process: analyzing user behavior, forming a hypothesis, and using A/B testing to validate changes on landing pages, emails, or ads.

title: Developing a Digital Marketing Plan
note: This final lesson provides a framework for creating a cohesive digital marketing strategy. It covers the essential steps: setting SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound) goals, defining your target audience and buyer personas, conducting a competitive analysis, choosing your channels, and setting a budget.
